issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.youtube.com/shorts/66aAUaPjApA](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.youtube.com%2Fshorts%2F66aAUaPjApA) ### Comment > Не знаю связано это или нет, но на всякий случай отмечу: ранее ни одной рекламы не было, а после последнего обновления AdGuard, появилась. # ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: x.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://x.com/a](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2Fa) ### Comment > > > This issue concerns the promotion of mobile app appearing when opening an account profile in a browser. > > I’ve confirmed reproduction on iOS Safari and Windows Chrome (with the user agent set to `Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 18_6_2 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/18.6 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1`). > I have confirmed that this is not due to country factors by accessing from multiple countries (Italy, Germany, Japan, Australia). > > > In attempting to reproduce this issue using an iPhone, I took care with the following matters: > I cleared Safari’s cache. > I ensured no extensions other than AdGuard were enabled. > I powered off the iPhone and then restarted it. > In Safari settings, I disabled all content blockers and then re-enabled them. > After that, I restarted Safari. > I also restarted AdGuard, and checked for filter updates in AdGuard. During the filter update, I kept the AdGuard window open for two minutes. ### Screenshots

||freewheel-jitt.sanoma.fi^

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://apps.apple.com/ua/app/butterflymx/id714133074](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapps.apple.com%2Fua%2Fapp%2Fbutterflymx%2Fid714133074) ### Comment > Enable DNS in Adguard for IOS App and try to use the butterflyMX app and it won’t work. The app will fail and it says can’t connect to network. > Also if I have the DNS enabled and I am watching YouTube in the YouTube app and a phone call comes in and I answer it. The phone freezes. The call stays connected but the screen doesn’t respond to taps and the buttons on the sides of the phone do nothing. I have to wait for the springboard to crash and it restarts the springboard and than I can use the phone like normal. Once I disabled the DNS the problem stopped happening. Very strange why that was happening ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://mbway.pt](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmbway.pt) ### Comment > This is a Portuguese banking app. It was running correctly before 2nd October 2025 (considering my rooted setup); no root changes, profiles or module alterations were made between 1st October and today. > > Unfortunately, it stopped working properly since; startup is slow, authentication via biometrics fails (as in, it accepts it but srill shows the PIN keypad as if nothing happened), and accessing sensitive screens (after manually inputting my pin) results in a loading spinner animation for about 10 seconds before it shows an error message. > > I've tried disabling multiple Adblock options, Tracking parameters, DNS filtering, nothing changes; the app works again if I disable Adguard entirely, or if I disable the "Filter traffic" for the app. > > The filtered logs barely show any trace of a blocked query related to the app. ``` Username: @Keyaku ``` ### Screenshots

issue.title: mbway.pt
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://mbway.pt](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmbway.pt) ### Comment > This is a Portuguese banking app. It was running correctly before 2nd October 2025 (considering my rooted setup); no root changes, profiles or module alterations were made between 1st October and today. > > Unfortunately, it stopped working properly since; startup is slow, authentication via biometrics fails (as in, it accepts it but srill shows the PIN keypad as if nothing happened), and accessing sensitive screens (after manually inputting my pin) results in a loading spinner animation for about 10 seconds before it shows an error message. > > I've tried disabling multiple Adblock options, Tracking parameters, DNS filtering, nothing changes; the app works again if I disable Adguard entirely, or if I disable the "Filter traffic" for the app. > > The filtered logs barely show any trace of a blocked query related to the app. ``` Username: @Keyaku ``` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for iOS ### AdGuard version 4.5.12 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Mobile ### Where is the problem encountered? https://tarnkappe.info/artikel/it-sicherheit/datenschutz/ublock-origin-als-mittel-gegen-laestige-cookie-banner-321303.html ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific AdGuard German filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots The URL is blocked on iPhone. You can't open this article at all.
Screenshot 1:
However, this URL is so much blocked, that was unable to open `reports.adguard.com` within that URL as referal on Safari (iPhone). It's not even possible to report that URL on Computer. "Check URL, something is wrong". There is a general issue with that URL.
Screenshot:

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://mbway.pt](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmbway.pt) ### Comment > This is a Portuguese banking app. It was running correctly before 2nd October 2025 (considering my rooted setup); no root changes, profiles or module alterations were made between 1st October and today. > > Unfortunately, it stopped working properly since; startup is slow, authentication via biometrics fails (as in, it accepts it but srill shows the PIN keypad as if nothing happened), and accessing sensitive screens (after manually inputting my pin) results in a loading spinner animation for about 10 seconds before it shows an error message. > > I've tried disabling multiple Adblock options, Tracking parameters, DNS filtering, nothing changes; the app works again if I disable Adguard entirely, or if I disable the "Filter traffic" for the app. > > The filtered logs barely show any trace of a blocked query related to the app. ``` Username: @Keyaku ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
> I've tried disabling multiple Adblock options, Tracking parameters, DNS filtering, nothing changes; the app works again if I disable Adguard entirely, or if I disable the "Filter traffic" for the app.

Hi! Unfortunately, I can't check this app on my end, but as I see, it's not related to the filters or other modules. I'll move this issue to another repo.

> the app works again if I disable Adguard entirely, or if I disable the "Filter traffic" for the app.

I think it can be excluded from the filtration. For now, disable the `filter traffic` for the app.

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.6 to 16.2.3
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.6 to 16.2.3.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1669 27cd541 Thanks @​iiroj! - When using --fail-on-changes, automatically hidden (partially) unstaged changes are no longer counted to make lint-staged fail.

v16.2.2

Patch Changes

  • #1667 699f95d Thanks @​iiroj! - The backup stash will not be dropped when using --fail-on-changes and there are errors. When reverting to original state is disabled (via --no-revert or --fail-on-changes), hidden (partially) unstaged changes are still restored automatically so that it's easier to resolve the situation manually.

    Additionally, the example for using the backup stash manually now uses the correct backup hash, if available:

    % npx lint-staged --fail-on-changes
✔ Backed up original state in git stash (c18d55a3)
✔ Running tasks for staged files...
✖ Tasks modified files and --fail-on-changes was used!
↓ Cleaning up temporary files...

    ✖ lint-staged failed because --fail-on-changes was used.
    

    Any lost modifications can be restored from a git stash:
    

    > git stash list --format="%h %s"
c18d55a3 On main: lint-staged automatic backup
> git apply --index c18d55a3

v16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

v16.2.0

Minor Changes

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1669 27cd541 Thanks @​iiroj! - When using --fail-on-changes, automatically hidden (partially) unstaged changes are no longer counted to make lint-staged fail.

16.2.2

Patch Changes

  • #1667 699f95d Thanks @​iiroj! - The backup stash will not be dropped when using --fail-on-changes and there are errors. When reverting to original state is disabled (via --no-revert or --fail-on-changes), hidden (partially) unstaged changes are still restored automatically so that it's easier to resolve the situation manually.

    Additionally, the example for using the backup stash manually now uses the correct backup hash, if available:

    % npx lint-staged --fail-on-changes
✔ Backed up original state in git stash (c18d55a3)
✔ Running tasks for staged files...
✖ Tasks modified files and --fail-on-changes was used!
↓ Cleaning up temporary files...

    ✖ lint-staged failed because --fail-on-changes was used.
    

    Any lost modifications can be restored from a git stash:
    

    > git stash list --format="%h %s"
c18d55a3 On main: lint-staged automatic backup
> git apply --index c18d55a3

16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • bdcd03a chore(changeset): release
  • 27cd541 fix: do not count hidden (partially) unstaged changes when using `--fail-on-c...
  • ab2f42e fix: emit correct value to debug logs
  • 3fc5832 refactor: make general error messages more clear they originate from lint-staged
  • 409d79a chore(changeset): release
  • 7edaee9 docs: fix typo in changeset
  • 699f95d fix: backup stash example uses real hash if available
  • 47d01a9 fix: print backup stash example when failing to --fail-on-changes
  • 325dc03 fix: restore unstaged changes on errors when --fail-on-errors or `--no-reve...
  • 53bb27b fix: do not drop backup stash when errors and --fail-on-changes was used
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.6 to 16.2.3
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.6 to 16.2.3.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1669 27cd541 Thanks @​iiroj! - When using --fail-on-changes, automatically hidden (partially) unstaged changes are no longer counted to make lint-staged fail.

v16.2.2

Patch Changes

  • #1667 699f95d Thanks @​iiroj! - The backup stash will not be dropped when using --fail-on-changes and there are errors. When reverting to original state is disabled (via --no-revert or --fail-on-changes), hidden (partially) unstaged changes are still restored automatically so that it's easier to resolve the situation manually.

    Additionally, the example for using the backup stash manually now uses the correct backup hash, if available:

    % npx lint-staged --fail-on-changes
✔ Backed up original state in git stash (c18d55a3)
✔ Running tasks for staged files...
✖ Tasks modified files and --fail-on-changes was used!
↓ Cleaning up temporary files...

    ✖ lint-staged failed because --fail-on-changes was used.
    

    Any lost modifications can be restored from a git stash:
    

    > git stash list --format="%h %s"
c18d55a3 On main: lint-staged automatic backup
> git apply --index c18d55a3

v16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

v16.2.0

Minor Changes

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1669 27cd541 Thanks @​iiroj! - When using --fail-on-changes, automatically hidden (partially) unstaged changes are no longer counted to make lint-staged fail.

16.2.2

Patch Changes

  • #1667 699f95d Thanks @​iiroj! - The backup stash will not be dropped when using --fail-on-changes and there are errors. When reverting to original state is disabled (via --no-revert or --fail-on-changes), hidden (partially) unstaged changes are still restored automatically so that it's easier to resolve the situation manually.

    Additionally, the example for using the backup stash manually now uses the correct backup hash, if available:

    % npx lint-staged --fail-on-changes
✔ Backed up original state in git stash (c18d55a3)
✔ Running tasks for staged files...
✖ Tasks modified files and --fail-on-changes was used!
↓ Cleaning up temporary files...

    ✖ lint-staged failed because --fail-on-changes was used.
    

    Any lost modifications can be restored from a git stash:
    

    > git stash list --format="%h %s"
c18d55a3 On main: lint-staged automatic backup
> git apply --index c18d55a3

16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

... (truncated)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
> Unfortunately, I'm not able to check it out without account.
> 
> Could you please disable `AdGuard Tracking Protection` filter and then check if it solved the problem? If issue still continues, please enable it again and in `Tracking protection` panel, temporary disable `Hide Referer from third parties` (if it's enabled) and check if it works correctly.
> 
> Screenshot

Disabling the AdGuard Tracking Protection filter does work.

Then I tried enabling it again, disabling Tracking Protection in the settings, and that worked as well.

I then tried enabling Tracking Protection again but disabling, Hide Referer from third parties, and that worked as well without having to completely disabling all the Tracking Protection.

Do you think that is just an annoying design that they are using on that website, or is that something AdGuard should fix?

Thank you,
- John Jr

As far as I understand, disabling `Hide Referer from third parties` option fixes the problem, so I think that we could fix it in filters. Could you please enable `Hide Referer from third parties`, open DevTools (please press F12), go to network panel (in network panel you can search for `-status-code:200`), reproduce the problem and then check if there is/are request(s) highlighted in red? It should looks like on the screenshot below.

Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://sfb.bio.link ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist ### Other AdGuard Experimental filter ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard German filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots Hey, so bio.link gets blocked by both adguardDNS and My Adguard Client on Mac and WIndows Access blocked by AdGuard DNS: Dangerous website AdGuard DNS blocked access to thm.bio.link because it’s in our database of phishing and malicious domains The reason seems to be safebrowsing. Blocking the entire domain should not be needed. Blocking v2stats.bio.link analytics.bio.link is not the problem The problem is blocking PROFILENAME.bio.link bio.link/PROFILENAME cdn.bio.link I know someone who is friends with the owner, and the platform is NOT problematic. Some content is, but so is any website. Please keep me up to date on the issue by pinging @SpotlightForBugs Thank you ;D ### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.
Screenshot:

Screenshot:
I haven't thoroughly tested them yet. Once I'm sure the rules are working, I'll close the issue; if not, I'll write about it here.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Trackers)
 [https://montanablackmerch.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmontanablackmerch.com%2F)
### Comment
> This website is a fake merch site of the well-known German influencer MontanaBlack88. His official shop is at https://montanablack.de/ (currently closed according to him). On the fake site, clicking "Shop" or "Store" redirects to an external URL (https://teestow.com/product-category/montana-black-merch). Under "Contact," it shows a U.S. address (123 Fifth Avenue, NY 10160, New York), but his real shop is operated only in Germany, where he lives. I have already reported this site to Google Safe Browsing. Maybe you can block it via DNS Filter.
```
Username: @hArDsTyLe2000
```

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.
Screenshot:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Now, after testing, I can say that the site no longer works properly with these filtering rules. There's a page counter in the bottom middle that allows you to jump directly to any page, but it doesn't do it. The title button in the top left, between < and >, doesn't open the table of contents, and all buttons in the top right don't work except the outer ones (red one and comments).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.
Screenshot:

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.
Screenshot:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

Screenshot:
I haven't thoroughly tested them yet. Once I'm sure the rules are working, I'll close the issue; if not, I'll write about it here.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.
Screenshot:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Now, after testing, I can say that the site no longer works properly with these filtering rules. There's a page counter in the bottom middle that allows you to jump directly to any page, but it doesn't do it. The title button in the top left, between < and >, doesn't open the table of contents, and all buttons in the top right don't work except the outer ones (red one and comments).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://libraryc.org/librarybeau/admin/newsletter](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Flibraryc.org%2Flibrarybeau%2Fadmin%2Fnewsletter) ### Comment > You probably will not be able to see this yourself because this page probably only shows if someone is logged in. > > This is a new website that I logged into for work for the first time. > > But I noticed an error message on each section of the Newsletter settings page (https://libraryc.org/librarybeau/admin/newsletter). > > That says: "This domain is not registered in the TinyMCE Customer Portal. Please alert the admin to add it to the approved domains to continue using TinyMCE: https://www.tiny.cloud/docs/tinymce/latest/invalid-api-key/" > > It seems to be the AdGuard Tracker Protection List blocking third-party TinyMCE tracker(s) on that page, which is in one of the provided screenshots. > > If I pause AdGuard AdBlocker, that error message does not show up. > > Thank you, > - John Jr ``` Username: @goodjohnjr ``` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.
Screenshot:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Now, after testing, I can say that the site no longer works properly with these filtering rules. There's a page counter in the bottom middle that allows you to jump directly to any page, but it doesn't do it. The title button in the top left, between < and >, doesn't open the table of contents, and all buttons in the top right don't work except the outer ones (red one and comments).

issue.title: montanablackmerch.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Trackers)
 [https://montanablackmerch.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmontanablackmerch.com%2F)
### Comment
> This website is a fake merch site of the well-known German influencer MontanaBlack88. His official shop is at https://montanablack.de/ (currently closed according to him). On the fake site, clicking "Shop" or "Store" redirects to an external URL (https://teestow.com/product-category/montana-black-merch). Under "Contact," it shows a U.S. address (123 Fifth Avenue, NY 10160, New York), but his real shop is operated only in Germany, where he lives. I have already reported this site to Google Safe Browsing. Maybe you can block it via DNS Filter.
```
Username: @hArDsTyLe2000
```

### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Trackers)
 [https://montanablackmerch.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmontanablackmerch.com%2F)
### Comment
> This website is a fake merch site of the well-known German influencer MontanaBlack88. His official shop is at https://montanablack.de/ (currently closed according to him). On the fake site, clicking "Shop" or "Store" redirects to an external URL (https://teestow.com/product-category/montana-black-merch). Under "Contact," it shows a U.S. address (123 Fifth Avenue, NY 10160, New York), but his real shop is operated only in Germany, where he lives. I have already reported this site to Google Safe Browsing. Maybe you can block it via DNS Filter.
```
Username: @hArDsTyLe2000
```

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.oktoberfest.de/informationen/oktoberfest-webcams](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.oktoberfest.de%2Finformationen%2Foktoberfest-webcams) ### Comment > Live-Webcam can't be loaded. Website said: "Access to the stream has been denied." ``` Username: @hArDsTyLe2000 ``` ### Screenshots
